bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 16, 1897

div1.p: Lazear writes that he is glad Sweitzer has decided to go to Beverly, Massachusetts.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 16, 1897
div1.p:
I am glad
you have finally concluded
to go to Beverly.

Let me know exactly when
you will reach there
and I will send
the Baedeker. I do
not think it well to
send it to Hatley.
It is a pity you do
not like sailing or
rowing for Beverly
is very nice for that.
Be sure and notice
the beautiful doorways
at Salem and Beverly.

You will probably
meet Mr. Kilham's mother.
She is rather peculiar
a regular Yankee. She
belongs to the Putuam
family. I would
not be surprised if
Nellie Houston would come
down about Saturday a week.
So you and Mrs. Houston will
have the town to yourselves.

I saw Tom Brown in the distance
today but did not speak to
him.

I have not heard anything from
Uncle Tom for a long time. He
went to Seattle when Lytt was
to take him to Arizona or
Southern California.

Our hot wave is over but it
is not cold yet. Last Saturday
it was 97.

It has been a curious
summer
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son.
P.S. About two
weeks ago I sent
you a note en-
closing a letter that
came for you. Did
you get it? I also
redirected a letter
to you a day
or two ago.
J.W.L.
